intro: Stylidium streptocarpum, commonly known as the zigzag starburry, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its distinctive zigzagging stems. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, often clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it thrives in well-drained soils in open habitats. Stylidium streptocarpum is adapted to arid conditions and is often found in coastal areas and sandy soils.
